meanings.definition: Things that incite or provoke action.
meanings.sent1: The loud music at the concert acted as incitants for the crowd to dance.
meanings.sent2: The protest posters were powerful incitants for change in the community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used acorns as incitants to lead the other animals on a chase.
meanings.sent4: Her passionate speech served as incitants, igniting a fire in the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk was filled with incitants, motivating the team to give their all.

meanings.definition: Factors that stimulate or encourage behavior.
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of baking cookies was an irresistible incitants for the children to come to the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: Positive reinforcement can be a powerful incitants for students to excel in their studies.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy used his wagging tail as an incitants to get more treats from his owner.
meanings.sent4: The promise of a reward served as an incitants for the employees to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the finish line acted as a strong incitants for the marathon runners to push through the pain.
